org.factcenter.qilin.protocols.concrete

Class DefaultOTExtender

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.factcenter.qilin.protocols.concrete.DefaultOTExtender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BulkOT.Receiver, BulkOT.Sender, BulkOT.SplitReceiver, OT1of2.Chooser, OT1of2.Sender, OTExtender, ProtocolParty

    public class DefaultOTExtender
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProtocolParty, OTExtender
    A convenience class that constructs a (passively-secure) OT extender server/client pair with sensible defaults (use ECNaorPinkas as seeds, RC4 for PRG, default Qilin digest for random oracle, etc.). To use, after constructing the class you call both setParameters(Channel, Random) and setServerParameters(Channel, Random). Note that the communication channels must be different (since they will be used in different threads). The class's init() method initializes the client and and runs the extension server in a separate (daemon) thread. After calling init(), send(byte[], byte[]) and receive(int) will work, but may block at times while the extension server is generating additional OTs.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultOTExtender

        public DefaultOTExtender(int k,
                         int m,
                         int lowWaterMark,
                         int highWaterMark,
                         int partyId)
        Public Constructor
        Parameters:
        k - security parameter. Used as size of block for extension (minimum size is key-length in bits for the PRG)
        m - number of OTs in extended block. Must be greater than k
        lowWaterMark - When client gets below this many precomputed OTs, the server will start generating more.
        highWaterMark - When client has more than this many precomputed OTs, the server will rest.
        partyId - The Id of the party (one party should use 0 for this parameter, the other should use 1).

      • init

        public void init()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Initialize the server. This method creates (and starts) a new thread. The thread will be marked daemon, so it will not prevent the program from exiting. Note: you must call both setParameters(Channel, Random) and setServerParameters(Channel, Random) before calling this method
        Specified by:
        init in interface ProtocolParty

        java.io.IOException

      • receive

        public byte[] receive(int idx)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: OT1of2.Chooser
        Execute an OT transaction as the Chooser. The Chooser selects which of the two Sender inputs to learn. The sender will not learn anything about the Chooser's input.
        Specified by:
        receive in interface OT1of2.Chooser

        Returns:
